alert.note: Alert for Northern Westchester; Orange; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 7:55PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Westchester, southeastern Orange and Rockland Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 754 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near West Point to Warwick. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Peekskill, Monroe, West Point, Warwick, Greenwood Lake, Pomona, Harriman, Yorktown Heights, Kiryas Joel, Stony Point, Woodbury, West Haverstraw, Mount Ivy, Thiells and Buchanan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
